newsitem.title: USA: Key Energy gets $225 mln credit facility.
newsitem.headline: Key Energy gets $225 mln credit facility.

text.p: Key Energy Group Inc said Monday that it has entered into an agreement by which Lehman Brothers will provide a $225 million credit facility.
The facility will consist of a $100 million seven-year term loan and a $125 million five-year revolver.
According to Key Energy, the floating interest rate will be lower than the company's current rate on its existing bank debt.
The company said it intends to use the proceeds from the facility to repay existing bank debt, for acquisitions and capital expenditures and to provide working capital.
In addition, the credit facility provides under certain conditions for the repurchase of common stock in the open market from time to time.
The company said it expects the credit facility to be closed and funded within six weeks.
